result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel R. Conti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 13cf202 also called - New copy of citation has been received by court - Court gives findings - Court denies motionto reconsider courts factual findings - Court finds attorneys were not deficient - Court finds there was no prejudice to defendant in this matter - DNA surcharge, court finds DNA surcharge would be punitive and grants motion to remove DNA surcharge - Court denies motion for Post Conviction Relief - Babcock will draft order and fax today for Judges signature

Defendant Joel R. Conti in court, in custody with attorney Ana L. Babcock.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearanes given.  Court makes parties aware that the previous attorney is now a member to a board of a alumi that the judge belongs to.  The court does not feel that he needs to rescue.  The deft wishes to keep Ms Babcok as his attorney.  Discussions regarding the DNA surcharge.  Argurments heard.  The will come back to argue the issue of the DNA surcharge.  Will need to schedule half a day for the motions. Once scheduled for motion hearing the Ms Babcock will do the order to produce.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Ana L. Babcock appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft does not appear - State did not do an order to produce.  This was discussed at the scheduling conference.  We will not be able to proceed with this status conference.  Defense attorney addresses the court. Deft has two options. Proceed with current motion or discharge his attorney and proceed on his own.  State Pub will not appoint another attorney.  For appeals they only appoint one attorney.  Court rescheduled the status conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Joel R. Conti in court, in custody with attorney Ana L. Babcock- are both by phone.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called by the court.  Appearances given by the court.  Status of cases given.  Status hearing is because of a letter received from the letter.  Attorney wants to know how to proceed.  Court directs the clerk to send copy of the last letter to the ADA and attorney on the case.  Attorney and deft are not agreeing on how to proceed.  Deft does not want to  proced as the attorney has outlined.  Court will adjourn at this time so attorney can talk some more with the deft. Defendant Joel R. Conti in court, in custody with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached.  The deft enters a plea of no contest to the amended Count 1 in 13CF202 (removing the modifiers. ), Count 2 - DRI,  Deft enters a plea of no contest to amended  Count 1 in 14CF79 removing the Mod, Count 2-5 - DRI.  A stipulation will be done in regards to the 13CV146.    Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.
